intro: Phoradendron singulare, commonly known as the yellow mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that attaches to the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaceae and is characterized by its yellowish-green, leathery leaves and small, white or yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Its seeds are dispersed by birds that eat the berries, allowing the plant to spread to new hosts. Phoradendron singulare plays a role in forest ecosystems by influencing host tree growth and providing habitat for various organisms.
